Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NIR Image-Guided Lymphatic Mapping in Esophageal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted with 10 patients

Participants.evidence: 10 patients with resectable esophageal adenocarcinoma. Participants were enrolled at a single surgical center.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive either Indocyanine Green (ICG) alone or ICG pre-mixed with human serum albumin (ICG:HSA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the identification of regional lymph nodes (LNs) within the surgical field, measured intraoperatively.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted with 10 patients

Number_Analysed.evidence: NIR imaging identified NIR+ regional LNs in 6 out of 9 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: NIR imaging identified NIR+ regional LNs in 6 out of 9 patients, with 2â€“6 LNs detected per patient.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the intervention were reported.
